org.jtrim.property

Class BoolProperties

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jtrim.property.BoolProperties

  • public final class BoolProperties
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines static factory methods for properties having a Boolean value.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • same

        public static <ValueType> PropertySource<java.lang.Boolean> same(PropertySource<? extends ValueType> property1,
                                                 PropertySource<? extends ValueType> property2)
        Returns a property which is true, if, and only, if the values of the properties are equal based on their reference.

        The returned property is notified of changes whenever the value of any of the specified properties changes.

        The value of the returned property is never null. This method is effectively equivalent to calling 

         BoolProperties.equals(property1, property2, Equality.referenceEquality())
        Warning: It is assumed that the values of the properties are immutable. Or at least, the result of the comparison may only change if the value of the properties change (as defined by the change listener).
        Type Parameters:
        ValueType - the type of the value of the properties
        Parameters:
        property1 - the first property to be compared. This argument cannot be null (but its value can be null).
        property2 - the second property to be compared. This argument cannot be null (but its value can be null).
        Returns:
        a property which is true, if, and only, if the values of the properties are equal based on the given comparison. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if any of the arguments is null

      • equals

        public static <ValueType> PropertySource<java.lang.Boolean> equals(PropertySource<? extends ValueType> property1,
                                                   PropertySource<? extends ValueType> property2)
        Returns a property which is true, if, and only, if the values of the properties are equal based on their equals method (same as equalProperties).

        The returned property is notified of changes whenever the value of any of the specified properties changes.

        The value of the returned property is never null. This method is effectively equivalent to calling 

         BoolProperties.equals(property1, property2, Equality.naturalEquality())
        Warning: It is assumed that the values of the properties are immutable. Or at least, the result of the comparison may only change if the value of the properties change (as defined by the change listener).

        Note: This method does the same thing as equalProperties.

        Type Parameters:
        ValueType - the type of the value of the properties
        Parameters:
        property1 - the first property to be compared. This argument cannot be null (but its value can be null).
        property2 - the second property to be compared. This argument cannot be null (but its value can be null).
        Returns:
        a property which is true, if, and only, if the values of the properties are equal based on the given comparison. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if any of the arguments is null

      • equalProperties

        public static <ValueType> PropertySource<java.lang.Boolean> equalProperties(PropertySource<? extends ValueType> property1,
                                                            PropertySource<? extends ValueType> property2)
        Returns a property which is true, if, and only, if the values of the properties are equal based on their equals method (same as equals).

        The returned property is notified of changes whenever the value of any of the specified properties changes.

        The value of the returned property is never null. This method is effectively equivalent to calling 

         BoolProperties.equalProperties(property1, property2, Equality.naturalEquality())
        Warning: It is assumed that the values of the properties are immutable. Or at least, the result of the comparison may only change if the value of the properties change (as defined by the change listener).

        Note: This method does the same thing as equals. This method is only provided, because equals cannot be used with static imports.

        Type Parameters:
        ValueType - the type of the value of the properties
        Parameters:
        property1 - the first property to be compared. This argument cannot be null (but its value can be null).
        property2 - the second property to be compared. This argument cannot be null (but its value can be null).
        Returns:
        a property which is true, if, and only, if the values of the properties are equal based on the given comparison. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if any of the arguments is null

      • equals

        public static <ValueType> PropertySource<java.lang.Boolean> equals(PropertySource<? extends ValueType> property1,
                                                   PropertySource<? extends ValueType> property2,
                                                   org.jtrim.collections.EqualityComparator<? super ValueType> comparator)
        Returns a property which is true, if, and only, if the values of the properties are equal based on the given comparison (same as equalProperties).

        The returned property is notified of changes whenever the value of any of the specified properties changes.

        The value of the returned property is never null.

        Warning: It is assumed that the values of the properties are immutable. Or at least, the result of the comparison may only change if the value of the properties change (as defined by the change listener).

        Note: This method does the same thing as equalProperties.

        Type Parameters:
        ValueType - the type of the value of the properties
        Parameters:
        property1 - the first property to be compared. This argument cannot be null (but its value can be null).
        property2 - the second property to be compared. This argument cannot be null (but its value can be null).
        comparator - the EqualityComparator defining what values are to be considered equivalent. This argument cannot be null.
        Returns:
        a property which is true, if, and only, if the values of the properties are equal based on the given comparison. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if any of the arguments is null

      • equalProperties

        public static <ValueType> PropertySource<java.lang.Boolean> equalProperties(PropertySource<? extends ValueType> property1,
                                                            PropertySource<? extends ValueType> property2,
                                                            org.jtrim.collections.EqualityComparator<? super ValueType> comparator)
        Returns a property which is true, if, and only, if the values of the properties are equal based on the given comparison (same as equals).

        The returned property is notified of changes whenever the value of any of the specified properties changes.

        The value of the returned property is never null.

        Warning: It is assumed that the values of the properties are immutable. Or at least, the result of the comparison may only change if the value of the properties change (as defined by the change listener).

        Note: This method does the same thing as equals. This method is only provided, because equals cannot be used with static imports.

        Type Parameters:
        ValueType - the type of the value of the properties
        Parameters:
        property1 - the first property to be compared. This argument cannot be null (but its value can be null).
        property2 - the second property to be compared. This argument cannot be null (but its value can be null).
        comparator - the EqualityComparator defining what values are to be considered equivalent. This argument cannot be null.
        Returns:
        a property which is true, if, and only, if the values of the properties are equal based on the given comparison. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if any of the arguments is null

      • sameWithConst

        public static <ValueType> PropertySource<java.lang.Boolean> sameWithConst(PropertySource<? extends ValueType> property,
                                                          ValueType constValue)
        Returns a property which is true, if, and only, if the value of the given property and the specified constant value are equal based on their reference.

        The returned property is notified of changes whenever the value of the given property changes.

        The value of the returned property is never null. This method is effectively equivalent to calling 

         BoolProperties.equalsWithConst(property, constValue, Equality.referenceEquality())

        Warning: It is assumed that the value of the specified property and the constant value is immutable. Or at least, the result of the comparison may only change if the value of the specified property changes (as defined by the change listener).

        Type Parameters:
        ValueType - the type of the value of the properties
        Parameters:
        property - the property to be compared against the constant value. This argument cannot be null (but its value can be null).
        constValue - the constant value to be compared against the value of the specified property. This argument is allowed to be null (note however, that null only equals to null for any properly implemented equals method).
        Returns:
        a property which is true, if, and only, if the values of the given property and the specified constant value are equal based on the given comparison. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified property or the comparison is null

      • equalsWithConst

        public static <ValueType> PropertySource<java.lang.Boolean> equalsWithConst(PropertySource<? extends ValueType> property,
                                                            ValueType constValue)
        Returns a property which is true, if, and only, if the value of the given property and the specified constant value are equal based on their equals method.

        The returned property is notified of changes whenever the value of the given property changes.

        The value of the returned property is never null. This method is effectively equivalent to calling 

         BoolProperties.equalsWithConst(property, constValue, Equality.naturalEquality())

        Warning: It is assumed that the value of the specified property and the constant value is immutable. Or at least, the result of the comparison may only change if the value of the specified property changes (as defined by the change listener).

        Type Parameters:
        ValueType - the type of the value of the properties
        Parameters:
        property - the property to be compared against the constant value. This argument cannot be null (but its value can be null).
        constValue - the constant value to be compared against the value of the specified property. This argument is allowed to be null (note however, that null only equals to null for any properly implemented equals method).
        Returns:
        a property which is true, if, and only, if the values of the given property and the specified constant value are equal based on the given comparison. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified property or the comparison is null

      • equalsWithConst

        public static <ValueType> PropertySource<java.lang.Boolean> equalsWithConst(PropertySource<? extends ValueType> property,
                                                            ValueType constValue,
                                                            org.jtrim.collections.EqualityComparator<? super ValueType> comparator)
        Returns a property which is true, if, and only, if the value of the given property and the specified constant value are equal based on the given comparison.

        The returned property is notified of changes whenever the value of the given property changes.

        The value of the returned property is never null.

        Warning: It is assumed that the value of the specified property and the constant value is immutable. Or at least, the result of the comparison may only change if the value of the specified property changes (as defined by the change listener).

        Type Parameters:
        ValueType - the type of the value of the properties
        Parameters:
        property - the property to be compared against the constant value. This argument cannot be null (but its value can be null).
        constValue - the constant value to be compared against the value of the specified property. This argument is allowed to be null (note however, that null only equals to null for any properly implemented EqualityComparator).
        comparator - the EqualityComparator defining what values are to be considered equivalent. This argument cannot be null.
        Returns:
        a property which is true, if, and only, if the values of the given property and the specified constant value are equal based on the given comparison. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified property or the comparison is null

      • not

        public static PropertySource<java.lang.Boolean> not(PropertySource<java.lang.Boolean> property)
        Returns a property which has the negated value of the specified property. If the value of the specified property is null, then the value of the returned property is also null. That is, the returned property applies the following conversion:
        • false -> true
        • true -> false
        • null -> null
        Parameters:
        property - the property whose value is to be negated. This argument cannot be null.
        Returns:
        a property which has the negated value of the specified property. This method never returns null.

      • or

        @SafeVarargs
public static PropertySource<java.lang.Boolean> or(PropertySource<java.lang.Boolean>... properties)
        Returns a property which is true, if, and only, if at least one of the specified property is true. That is, the result is the logical "or" of the values of the specified properties (defining null to be false).

        Corner cases:

        • null value for the specified property is equivalent to false.
        • Specifying zero properties will yield in a property always being false.
        The value of the returned property can never be null.
        Parameters:
        properties - the properties whose logical "or" is to be returned. This argument cannot be null and none of the specified properties can be null.
        Returns:
        a property which is true, if, and only, if at least one of the specified property is true. This method never returns null.

      • and

        @SafeVarargs
public static PropertySource<java.lang.Boolean> and(PropertySource<java.lang.Boolean>... properties)
        Returns a property which is true, if, and only, if none of the specified property is true. That is, the result is the logical "and" of the values of the specified properties (defining null to be true).

        Corner cases:

        • null value for the specified property is equivalent to true.
        • Specifying zero properties will yield in a property always being true.
        The value of the returned property can never be null.
        Parameters:
        properties - the properties whose logical "or" is to be returned. This argument cannot be null and none of the specified properties can be null.
        Returns:
        a property which is true, if, and only, if at least one of the specified property is true. This method never returns null.

      • addBoolPropertyListener

        public static org.jtrim.event.ListenerRef addBoolPropertyListener(PropertySource<java.lang.Boolean> property,
                                                  BoolPropertyListener listener)
        Adds a BoolPropertyListener to be notified when the specified property changes. The listener is notified lazily just like PropertyFactory.lazilyNotifiedSource does.

        Note that this method treats null values of the specified property as false values. If you don't like this behaviour, wrap the specified property and convert its null values to true.

        Parameters:
        property - the PropertySource which is to be checked for changes. This argument cannot be null.
        listener - the listener to be notified whenever the value of the specified PropertySource changes. This argument cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the ListenerRef which can be used to unregister the currently added listener, so that it will no longer be notified of subsequent changes. This method may never return null.

      • addBoolPropertyListener

        public static org.jtrim.event.ListenerRef addBoolPropertyListener(PropertySource<java.lang.Boolean> property,
                                                  BoolPropertyListener listener,
                                                  org.jtrim.concurrent.UpdateTaskExecutor executor)
        Adds a BoolPropertyListener to be notified when the specified property changes on a given executor. The listener is notified lazily just like PropertyFactory.lazilyNotifiedSource does.

        Note that this method treats null values of the specified property as false values. If you don't like this behaviour, wrap the specified property and convert its null values to true.

        Warning: The specified executor should not execute tasks concurrently, otherwise the listener might get notified concurrently, which is not expected by BoolPropertyListener implementations.

        Parameters:
        property - the PropertySource which is to be checked for changes. This argument cannot be null.
        listener - the listener to be notified whenever the value of the specified PropertySource changes. This argument cannot be null.
        executor - the executor on which the
        Returns:
        the ListenerRef which can be used to unregister the currently added listener, so that it will no longer be notified of subsequent changes. This method may never return null.
